Line: Yuri! This is not good!
Ted! Ted! You get down here! They need your help, too!
Yeah, but you're late so I'm not sharing.
Hey, its sink or swim in this world.
Looks like that blue-blooded mage we hired to fix the blastia left the job half done.
He feels responsible. He's the one who pushed the people to get the money together for the repairs.
That's true. He even parted with his wife's keepsake to help raise the money.
He always seems to cause problems when the lower quarter's involved.
Well, it's just an average day for Yuri. I'm sure he'll be fine.
Hey, you hear about the blastia in the lower quarter?
Yes, I heard something about it breaking and them collecting money to fix it.
That's right, I hear that lot went so far as to sell their treasures to save up the money.
Treasures, sir?
Worthless junk, nothing more. They wouldn't have gotten more than one Gald for them.
Not even one Gald?! I can't imagine what sort of treasures those would have to be. I'd like to have a look, myself ...
I'm telling you, nothing but junk! Heh heh ...
Ack!
What the ... Who's there?!
Oof!
So like I was sayin', the thief made off with a priceless treasure from that noble's mansion.
I know, I know. Then he was caught, and the loot was returned, right?
No. See, that's just nobility tryin' ta keep things quiet. The treasure in the mansion right now's a fake.
You're pulling my leg.
Hey, ya didn't hear it from me, bub. The Dark Wings are goin' nuts lookin' for the hideout.
You mean the thieves' guild?
Ahem! That's enough out of you. Almost meal time.
Hey neighbor! You're awake right? You gotta be gettin' tired from keepin' so quiet.
“Old man?” Now you've gone and hurt this old man's feelings.
Besides, I didn't make up nothin'. I've got eyes and ears the world over diggin' up information for me.
Hey, I am what I am. Go ahead and ask me something. I'll tell ya whatever ya want to know.
Wanna know about the pirate guild's sunken treasure? How 'bout the sorcerer who makes his home at the ends of the earth? Or wait, I've got it ...
Well I'm not sure what yer in for, but they'll let ya out if ya keep yer trap shut for ten days.
The lower quarter ... Ah yeah, I heard about that.
Sorry, neighbor. That's one piece of dirt I don't have.
THE Mordio? You mean to say you've got connections ta the famed mage from Aspio, the City of Scholars?
Oho! Want ta know, huh? I'm afraid that information won't come cheap ...
W-wait, that's not it. He's the, uh, the head of the gourmet guild! No wait, it's the, uh, I mean ...
Out.
Ah well, just when things were gettin' good.
Hurry up.
Whoa!
Beneath the statue of the goddess.
All right, easy. I'm coming.
Who's there?!
You again!
How'd you get away?! You little ... Get over here!
Why don't we just go back?
I can't go back now!
This is for your own good, Miss, you know that.
As for the “incident”, we assume full responsibility and will inform the lieutenant ourselves.
How can you say that when you haven't done anything to help me?
Please, don't come any closer.
Now, now, why don't you put that down? You'll only end up hurting yourself ...
I know how to use a sword!
I'm afraid you leave us no choice. I was hoping it wouldn't come to this.
Hey! There she is! This way!
Please, you've got to let me go!
I have to warn Flynn!
Aaah!
Hey!
Flynn?! You came to help me ... ?
W-who are you?
Identify yourself!
Careful, I think he's got a blastia.
It shouldn't be a problem if we take him together.
Want some more, huh?
Let's finish him!
Aaah!
Aaah!
Hyah!
Well ... you don't belong in the castle, right?
Yuri Looowell! Where are yooou?
Louder, fools! Say it like you mean it!
Yuri Lowell? You're one of Flynn's friends, aren't you?
And you used to belong to the Imperial Knights?
Yes.
Yuri! I need to talk to Flynn!
Over here!
Ah, yes!
Oh, you're right. What could it be?
Yeah, it was around here ...
Then ... That means I'm too late.
Me? I haven't done anything wrong.
Um, you see ... Yuri!
I can't be specific, but Flynn is in terrible danger!
I've got to go and warn him.
I wish I knew ...
In that case, would you take me with you? Please?
Other than Flynn, there's no one I can depend on.
Will you at least help me get out of the castle?
Please, I'm begging you.
Aaah!
Prepare to fall victim to my blade ...
Yuri, let me help you!
But--!
I will.
He's not Flynn!
Zagi, we're leaving. The Knights are onto us.
How dare you!
Hurry, before the Knights get here. Or would you rather have your fun end today?
Yuri, um.
When are you going to fix the fountain, Sir Knight?
Hey cool, a knight!
Hooray! Hooray!
Won't you help this old man find his dentures?
Don't you make her cry!
This might come in handy if you're going to Halure.
What did you expect? It's better than nothing considering people don't normally leave the city.
You'll have to fill in the empty spaces on your own.
First off, you should head for Deidon Hold to the north.
Welcome. I've got some nice gear in stock today.
This blade was forged by none other than Assam the blademaster. It even comes equipped with weapon skills.
No traveler should be without them. Feel free to give it a try.
My, this young lady knows her stuff. That about sums it up.
In order to find the fighting style that meets your needs ...
... it's best to think carefully about weapon skills when choosing your weapon.
There are even weapons without weapon skills, that focus instead on raw attack power. It all depends on your preference.
If a weapon has weapon skills sealed inside it ...
... those weapon skills will be stored inside your bodhi blastia when you keep the weapon equipped for a while.
If you have a weapon equipped, you can use the weapon skills sealed inside whenever you want.
However, if you unequip that weapon, you'll have to set the weapon skills to be able to use them.
Each weapon skill belongs to one of four different categories.
When you set a few different skills, depending on what category they are ...
... a particular glyph will appear on the core of your bodhi blastia.
So, if you had a bunch of weapon skills for attacking, you'd see a glyph called fleck.
That glyph lets you know the strength of your physical attacks has gone up.
Try all of the combinations you can think of to see what they do.
I'm afraid the sun would set long before I could explain them all to you.
Did you get all of that?
You learn fast.
You should be able to read all about it in that young lady's book.
Hmmm, well, it is pretty complicated.
You should be able to read all about it in that young lady's book.
Don't get me wrong, I'm not here because I want to be.
There are monsters on the far side of the Hold, so I'm stuck.
That's all right, go ahead and take it. It's pretty old and it has some pages missing, but it's yours if you like.
Hurry, get inside! The gate's closing!
Arrows! Bring the arrows!
Shut the gate now!
Dammit! What are they doing here this time of the year.
The monsters will fall back if we stop the main charge! Remember your training!
Okay! They're all in! Close it up!
Hold the gate! There's still more ...
... ?! The gate!
Wh-what the hell! Cut it out!
P-Please ... I can't get up ... Owww ... ! The monsters! The monsters!
... Hey, I can ... I can stand ...
My doll, mama's doll!
How can I ever thank you?
I'm not sure what I would have done if you hadn't cured me. Thanks!
You two there. I'd like to have a word with you.
So why don't you let us through? I'll beat those monsters to a pulp with these fists of mine!
How many times do I have to say it? These monsters are tougher than you think!
You dare to doubt the power of the monster hunters?
S-stop!
Stay out of this! You Knights cheated us out of a job back there, and now we're gonna work off some steam!
Hey, hold it!
It's always the same with these guild idiots!
You there, how about coming to work for me? You'll be paid, of course.
Watch your manners around the President. Well, whaddya say?
Watch your mouth!
You're just as charming as I expected. I'm Kaufman of the merchants' guild, Fortune's Market.
We handle everything from trade to distribution.
P-prepare to die, eggbear!
Whoa!
Waaaaah! OOF!
Ooh, man that hurt ...
Gyaah!
I-I'm warning you! I don't taste very good. You'll get the runs!
Oh my gosh, s-s-somebody h-h-help me--! Aaaah!!
Huh? The monster turned into a girl?
I'm Karol Capel! I'm a member of the Hunting Blades guild. We travel the globe in search of the toughest monsters!
Oh my, you can use healing artes?
Why, that would be excellent! ... But I'm afraid we don't have very much money ...
Amazing ... The pain is all gone. Th-thank you. Thank you so very much.
My heavens, what amazing healing artes you have ...
How can we ever thank you?
What a humble young lady. I wish the Imperial Knights could follow your example.
Not a chance! The Knights refuse to lift a finger to protect us from the monsters!
Well, I guess the empire couldn't care less what happens to us here.
Ah, but that one knight sure was different, wasn't he?
Yes, that young man. If not for him, we would have all been lost.
The barrier weakened earlier than usual this year, and we were attacked before the guild could come to protect us.
There was a knight who happened to be passing through our town on a pilgrimage. He and his brigade drove off all the monsters.
Yes, his name was Flynn Scifo.
No, he left the village afterwards in search of a mage who could fix the barrier.
It looked like he was headed east, but beyond that I couldn't tell you ...
Yeah! We got weapons now! We're gonna beat those monsters!
The mayor's gonna let us fight now!
Let's beat up those monsters, just like Flynn!
Yeah!
Yeah!
Yeah!
What are the two of you doing over here?
I don't know if you'll make much progress on that one. That knight, Flynn, couldn't figure out the reason either.
It seems these two are trying to figure out the reason the tree's withered so.
What! The monster blood? I had no idea ...
Howdy, welcome to the store! What can I get for you today?
Unfortunately we're sold out at the moment.
But you know, if I had the right ingredients, I'd be able to fix some up for you.
I'd need three ingredients: An eggbear claw, a nia fruit, and a luluria petal.
But why do you need a panacea bottle so badly?
A kid came by the other day asking about the same exact thing.
What's that? I've never heard of using a panacea bottle on a tree before ...
Sorry, I can't help you there. Monsters are beyond my expertise.
If a member of the Hunting Blades were here they might be able to tell you. They make their living hunting monsters.
You know the tree in the middle of town, right? It's a petal from that tree.
Normally we use magic resin but there isn't any around these parts at all.
I believe the mayor has some luluria petals. You might try asking him.
Who'd you hear that from? I mean, I do, but ...
Ahh, so that's why you need a petal.
The luluria is one of the three flowers that blooms on Halure's tree.
The petals are dried for half a year in the shade, and they're very valuable.
This is my last petal, but if it'll restore the tree to its old self, then I don't mind giving it to you.
Ah, you're back! Have you gotten all the ingredients together?
Eggbear claw, nia fruit, and luluria petals ... that's everything.
All right, let's get this stuff made.
Here you go, one panacea bottle!
Sorry, but synthesis costs Gald too.
I'll give you a special rate of 10 Gald this time. Come back whenever you're ready.
Hey, I thought you wanted to make a Panacea Bottle?
Select Panacea Bottle from the Synthesis menu. Now, try it again.
Oh! Have you made the antidote to cleanse the tree of poison?
Please, great tree of Halure. Restore the fallen barrier.
Please ...
I'm afraid that's impossible. That was the last of the luluria petals.
Can this be ... ?
Is she using healing artes ... ?
It's like a dream ...
There's no way ... and yet ...
Yay! Yay! You're the greatest!
Thanks for making the tree of Halure healthy again!
We owe you our gratitude. Thanks to this, our city can live once more ...
Please wait.
You deserve a reward for restoring our tree. Please stop by at my house.
I will be waiting at my house. Please come.
Welcome, welcome! Here, make yourself at home.
Are you leaving before that young knight is back?
Did something come up?
If there's anything I can do to help, don't hesitate to ask.
I see ... Then, it's not much, but I'd at least like you to take this.
But since your friend helped us out so much ...
But then how will I ever repay you?
... All right then. The next time you're here, I'll put my heart and soul into paying back what you've done for us!
... Aspio? Ah yes, I believe that was the name of the City of Shade ...
From what I've heard, the town lies between tall mountains, and sunlight rarely reaches its gates.
Every now and then, a few quiet folks in cloaks and hoods come to our town to get supplies ...
But they're quite creepy, to be honest. Our town doesn't deal with them much.
Towards the east, I think. I wish I could tell you the exact location ...
May I see your passport, please?
This is an Imperial facility. We can't just let anyone inside, can we?
If you filled out the official visitation paperwork, then you ought to have gotten your passport from this “associate” of yours.
What's your associate's name?
M-Mordio?!
W-we can't help you. You'll need to mail in a request and have a passport officially issued to you.
All information about the establishment is classified. We cannot share even small details with outsiders.
No, of course not.
I-I don't know who you're talking about! A knight named Flynn? N-never heard of him!
Wh-what do you want?
Flynn? Ohh, that guy, he was saying something about going to catch someone who'd been vandalizing ruins ...
I couldn't say. My research keeps me too busy to pay attention to things like that.
I'll be taking my leave, then.
Ack! There are people who want to see that weirdo?!
... No, uh, I don't know anything at all. I don't associate with people like that ...
What! What is it?!
Mordio lives alone in a shack back that way. Go and see for yourself if you want!
... Shut up ...
Thieves ...
... Be gone!!
Huh? Skipping town? Why would I need to skip town?
What? You're calling me a thief. Have you ever heard of “common sense”?
So you break into a home, call the owner a thief, and wave a sword in their face. What the hell kind of sense is that?!
Hey, dog! You stay back, you ... you dog!!
And you! Kid! Give him back!!
The blastia, the blastia!! Give him back to me!
W-what's with you?
So ... ? What do you want?
And?
Hmm, well Mordio is certainly my name. Rita Mordio, to be exact.
M-me? I'm just a blastia researcher from Aspio!
And just who are all of you? This place is off-limits, you know!
Gah! This job is just full of problems. If it's not the Knights, it's a bunch of kids!
Aaah! Stop! M-make him stop!
I've only been hired to do a job ... I was told I'd get a good price for any blastia cores I could find.
The capital? No way, not me!
Y-yeah! It's that creep, Dedecchi.
He's probably picking up his money from the client right now.
All I know is he's somewhere in Torim Harbor. I don't know any more than that!
He was a huge bruiser of a guy with a scar on his right cheek and one eye missing.
Wh-who says I stole it? The client gave it to me, said it would be useful for this job!
H-honest! You gotta believe me!
Man! First the Knights, then the monsters, now this ...
Yeah, that's him. That damn knight!
Oh, you've returned! Just as the knight said.
Unfortunately, you just missed him.
He was quite surprised that the barrier had been fixed.
No ... I'm sorry, I don't know ...
However, he did entrust me with a letter.
Hey, hey! No outsiders allowed!
Oh, you're a mage from Aspio? Excuse me!
Oh, but you can't just do as you please! Let me go and ask the--
There's nothing strange at all. Perhaps you are ...
I'm well aware of who you are. The famed genius mage, correct?
But surely there are some formulas that even you aren't familiar with!
H-Hey! Stop gawking and help us catch her!
What's with that kid?
A fire? I don't hear anything or smell anything ...
Hey! You little liar!
Hey! You are with that kid ...
Wait a minute ... You -- there's a warrant for your--
Argh, you little-- wait!
Hey! Stop goofing off and help catch that kid!
Damn ... !
I told you what would happen to that little brat if you didn't have our money!
Please, sir!! Not that! Please give me back my son!
With this awful weather the last few months, we haven't been able to launch the boats.
Surely you realize sir, we can't hope to pay our taxes like this.
You'd better hurry up and capture that Rhybgaro beast then, shouldn't you?
That's right. If you sell his horn, you'll never have to worry about taxes again. How many times do we have to tell you?
Teagle, that's enough! You're hurt ... You might even get yourself killed this time!
Yuri! Are you all right?
Ugh!
What are you trying to pull off, brat?
Now, now, why don't you eat this and relax?
I don't want it, and this ain't a place for kids like you.
Huh?
What's with you? Are you her father or something?
I'd like a rematch!
Ahh ... !
I'm just teaching her what it means to fight by adult rules.
Hyah!
Wh-what're you doing ... ?!
(cough) N-now you've done it ...
If you're going to grab a beautiful girl's hand, you'd best be prepared for the consequences.
Sadly, now's not the time to explain.
Farewell!
You bastard! Wait!
Tch, what was with that brat?!
Hey, you better make yourself scarce too!
Sir Flynn, I have news ... Wh-what is Rita doing here?!
I heard you refused an imperial request for assistance.
Do you think it's all right for a mage employed by the empire to simply abandon her obligations?
... Humph, whatever. It's not like I care a whit about you either.
Whaddaya want?
Hmph, go home! Scram! The magistrate is a busy man.
Hey, you better watch your mouth, punk!
Tough luck. Place is surrounded by a wall, and there's no gettin' inside unless ya can clear it.
Ya won't last long if ya go screamin' in a spot like this, yer ladyship.
Whaddya mean? Me and the kid there are old friends, right pal?
Now now, don't be like that. What about the fun times we had in jail, Mr. Yuri Lowell?
Huh? Ah, right ... I suppose Raven will do for now.
Pa ... pa, Ma ... Help me ... !
(Sob) (sob) Papa ... Mama ...
A scary old man brought me here ...
He said it was 'cuz Papa and Mama couldn't pay their taxes ...
Papa ... Mama ... I wanna go home ...
Pauly ...
Well, well, what do we have here? More delicious snacks for my pet, it seems.
What a nice view ...
It's what it looks like. I'm sightseeing!
Absolutely not.
Oh?
I know you.
Hmm, your name is ... Jack!
It's Patty.
Intrudeeeers!
Out of my way!
Hah. Was that spineless worm Ragou running from a bunch of kids?
Maybe I am ...
You're quick and you've got guts, too. My arm's gonna feel that ... Wish I had you in my guild.
But it's pushy guys like you I have to watch out for. Upsets the harmony of the guild, see? Nothing personal ...
... (Cough) ... Is anyone there?
That's far enough! This area is under the jurisdiction of the Hunting Blades.
These measures have been taken to prevent the injury of innocent bystanders.
Yuri! This is not good!
Ted! Ted! You get down here! They need your help, too!
Please take this.
Oh, I've been hearing that the barrier blastia's been acting up lately ...
E-explode? Did you hear that?!
Everybody, get out of here! Hurry!
... Commandant?!
Hmm? Well, well, if it ain't little Karol!
What the hell are you thinking, coming back here?
Yeah, I don't see Nan. She already ditch you? Ah hah hah hah!
So are you the latest guild to take him in? You could do a lot better than that loser!
All this kid can brag about is the number of guilds he's joined! Oh, right, that's a bad thing.
Wh-what did you say?!
Shut up!
Yeah, you just keep talking ...
Damn it ... They're back again ...
Come on!
Aah ... !
Th-thank you so much.
Come on ya filthy maggots, I'll take the lot of ya! Come see how it feels ta get beat down by an old man!
It's the Don! The Don's here!
Let's kick this monster scum outta here! Defend the city!
Nobody messes with the Clouds of Dawn!
We won't let you fix the barrier!
Hmm? Who are you all?
I haven't seen you around here recently. What guild do you belong to?
... Unfortunately, the Don has left town in pursuit of the monsters.
Yes, he plans on taking out the monster nests in one fell swoop.
No worries.
Where are you taking me?
Ohh ... you can use healing artes ... Thank you ...
Don, sorry to interrupt.
Out of the way! The Don is passing through!
Now shut up for a while!
Please, I've got to get out of here!
It's always somethin' with you, isn't it old man?
Yah!
That's enough.
Damn it ...
Well, after all, you did help Ba'ul back there.
Yes, my friend.
I'm afraid it's not as impressive as you might think.
I'm destroying them because I want to.
Yes, but I didn't finish the job.
... There wouldn't be any fun in destroying something like that.
Hmm ... It's true I wasn't able to finish off the blastia on the roof.
So what do we do?
Well, if you think it might work, what's the harm in trying it out?
I always say, “Those who can, should.”
I'll just follow your lead.
Ugh!
Pipe down!
You cut it out!
I said that's enough!
I've had it up to here with you!
So I'm gonna have ta teach ya a lesson, huh?
Oof!
Ta-dah, you're free.
I think I still owe you one more.
There, that makes us even.
Judith.
Aah ... !
Princess, we should be going.
Princess, you should know ...
... You see ...
Lord Ragou has not been seen since last night.
We do not yet know the details. His whereabouts are being investigated as we speak.
Your Highness ...
The insipid poison of this world must be purged.
I haven't seen my buddy for a while.
The work here is tough, and we're slaving away from dusk 'til dawn. I wonder if he up and ran off ...
We came to this land looking for a new way of life.
And once this city is completed, they say we'll get ranks, as well as monetary compensation for our trouble!
If you loiter around town causing problems, I'll have you arrested and taken into custody!
This city is brimming with hope! Every day it grows more and more!
Sorry, no can do, buddy. The laborers camp ahead is too dangerous.
Attract any ... Are you gonna wear it?
How about this?
Mmm ... Let's see ...
If you brought me a soft tail, basilisk scale and a small bird feather, I could make you something nice.
You should be able to get all of the items from monsters on the outskirts of the city.
Fascinating ... ? Are you out for a date? How about this?
Hmm ... well, how about this one?
All right, then what about this!
What exactly are you looking for?
N-no way! I have nothing like that.
Let's see ...
If you brought me a soft tail, basilisk scale and small bird feather, I could make you something very special.
You should be able to get all of the items from monsters on the outskirts of the city.
Extremely cute? Like something for a date?
Let's see ... Ummm ... you're a boy, am I right?
Ah, well ... Wait, why are you getting mad at me?
Anyway, I don't carry any clothing for young girls.
Ah, hold on ...
If you brought me a soft tail, basilisk scale and a small bird feather, I could make you something nice.
You should be able to get all of the items from monsters on the outskirts of the city.
Oh ho, you've brought the items.
Wait here while I make you something nice!
Oh ho, you've brought the items.
Wait here while I make you something nice!
Oh ho, you've brought the items.
Wait here while I make you something nice!
Huh ... W-Wha ... You're wearing such a ... Uh ...
Hmm? Hey ... You ... No it can't be ... Not in that kind of ...
It's just that you look ... a little like the Princess ...
Come a little closer, could you?
Why would you run away like that?
Ha ha ha ...
Ohhh, it's soooo hot out here ...
N-no, I d-didn't see anything! I didn't even see if there was anything to see!
A sh-shame ... ?
M-madly in love ... ?!
Err ... Maybe ... ?
Yeah! B-but ... there's someone back in the capital I promised to marry ...
But, I ... hmm ...
Hmm? Are you talking to me?
... N-no, I can't leave my post unattended!
I'm s-sorry! Please don't cry like that ...
Oh, all right. I can make some time, for your sake.
Hey! Quit goofing off over there!
You should get back to your post before things get even more out of hand!
The mage we captured is running wild! Hurry up!
Hey! Quit goofing off over there!
You should get back to your post before things get even more out of hand!
Calm down already! I'll ... I'll go call him right now!
Ah, milord. Are you sure you shouldn't be going to the Sands of Kogorh, now, Sir?
And I hope you'll remember to appreciate the work Leviathan's Claw has done for you.
Who said you could rest?! There's no time for that!
By Sir Cumore's orders, the construction must be completed within the month!
Urgh ...
What's with all of you?! Do as you're told!
Y-yeah. I take it the same goes for you?
Oh, that's right. I need to let my friends know that I'm okay.
Thank you very much.
So you thought you could run off while on the job? You know the penalty for that. A hundred lashes and a night in the water!
Eep! P-please forgive me!
You actually think you deserve forgiveness for what you did?!
B-but I can't move my arms anymore ...
Who do you think you are?! You dare defy the Cumore Brigade? You've forced my hand!
You saved me ...
They're building a military base in preparation for the Dahngrest invasion.
But that's just the official story. In reality, this place was made to be some big facility.
Correct.
A-are you sure?
Thank you very much!
Sir Cumore! It's the Flynn Brigade!
We tried, but he insists on coming down to perform an inspection.
Master Ioder, we should be off.
Against that many?! You've gotta be crazy!
I wouldn't do that even if I had nine lives!
Yes, Madam President.
Yeah, Leviathan's Claw was going to beat us there if we hadn't found an escort for the ship.
Still, I can't help but wonder where those slimeballs are getting their product from.
I think ... I'm a little seasick ...
We'll take a look at the ceres blastia. When we get it fixed, I'll signal you to head back.
Be sure to come back. I've had about enough of this drifting around.
I really do feel a bit helpless with just us here ...
S-sorry ...
Oh, M-Madam P-President. It's an honor t-to have you here.
Th-the excavation of r-ruins is wh-what I l-live for.
Lord Belius' private room is ahead. I cannot allow you to go any further.
What? Who are you?
... I haven't heard of you. Do you have an appointment with the Duce?
Unfortunately, my lord only meets with individuals who have appointments.
The Don ... Oh, my apologies.
My name is Natz. I am the acting representative for the Duce.
I will gladly deliver any message you have for the Duce.
Y-yes ...
Hey, you!
Um, I hate to ask, but could you perhaps be Aifread's granddaughter? Your outfit is quite unique ...
You see, there's been some rumors going around lately.
Apparently there's been a girl that wears the same outfit as Aifread, and she calls herself his granddaughter.
I knew it ...
Uh ... That'll be 450 Gald.
Um, well, this is hard to say, but would you mind not coming to my store anymore?
Uh, well, I don't really mind personally. It's just that it makes the other customers uncomfortable.
Huh? Wait ... me? Hold on a second! I didn't mean to ...
What do you mean? You're the one who said the store's reputation would go down if we served the granddaughter of the man who tarnished the honor of the guilds!

Hello. Welcome to the desert oasis, Mantaic.
Well, ummm ...
... Will, will you be staying the night?

Come back when you need to rest.

It would really be a good idea for you to stay in town ...
I see. Well, as I promised ...
It's the least I could do. I'm giving that to you, so don't hesitate to use it as much as you like.
Go out and turn right where the road forks. You'll find a lake at the end of the road.
You'll be able to fill up your canteens there.
... That was a supervisor. The knights are here to make sure that townspeople don't talk freely to visitors from outside of town.

Yes.

Thank you very much for your business!

(Gulp) I can feel the life coming back into me ...

... This is really all the water you have?

Please, come to Mantaic so that I can pay you back for what you've done.

Y-yes ...
Y-yes, okay.

Longchi had it ... Where did you get it?

Oh, my name is Yuefan.
Yes. Thanks to your help, we've recovered our strength.
We were thinking we'd cross the desert with you all. That is, if you don't mind.

Please, don't make us go!
That's just how we were sent into the desert.
Sir Cumore, everyone is aboard!

Sir Cumore, please, I beg of you! I have a wife and daughter ...

Thank you again for all your help.
Ohh ... ! You've returned safe from--!
... W-welcome back.
You must be tired. Please enjoy your stay.
Ah, are you going to the Weasand of Cados?
The Imperial Knights have sealed off passage through Cados.
It's not just here -- they've set up blockades at all of the routes through the mountains.
I don't know all the details, but I heard that it has something to do with some danger in Nordopolica.
I wish I could help, but they wouldn't even let me through, and I have a travel permit.
Yes.
Right, but the Imperial Knights wouldn't let me go any further.
I'm going back to Mantaic, since there's no way to get around them.
Wh-what the hell!
Stop it! Settle down!
What the-- Come back, you!

That's right, I hear that lot went so far as to sell their treasures to save up the money.

Worthless junk, nothing more. They wouldn't have gotten more than one Gald for them.

Okay. Feel free to stop by whenever you need work. I should be able to hook you up.

It should go pretty quick since you already know the client. You'll find her in the inn.

I'd be careful if I were you.
The current's pretty crazy around here, thanks to the ocean tides. If you fell in, you'd be swept off in a jiffy!
The water in this river is a mixture of ocean water and fresh water that runs down from the mountains. All of the rivers around here are like that.
Come to think of it, the body of the magistrate that they say was dumped into this river washed up over in Heliord.

Huh? For what ... ?

But I ...

I don't care which one of you gets it. I'll give the necklace to the first person who brings a small bird feather to me.
All right, I'm off. Farewell!
Dash ... !
My, that was quick.

The imperial capital of Zaphias.

Well, whenever you're in need of work, feel free to stop by. I should be able to hook you up.

Nothing personal, you know. I'll be rooting for Brave Vesperia's success in my own way.
Welcome to the Galactic Gearbox shop. What sort of trinket are you in the market for?
We've got some dazzling earrings made with the finest silver. Step right up!
Fraid not, ma'am. We focus on aesthetics here. ♪
Well, if you're not here to shop, what is it we can help you with?
Hey, you think he means that stuff Kale had written down in that old book of his?
That would be my best guess.
I dunno what we'd have done without that old book.
Processing Everlight is a pretty tricky business, you see.
Problem is, we don't have it anymore.
The Imperial Knights came some time ago, and took it with them when they left.
Wasn't it somethin' like the Cumore Brigade?
Yeah, he snatched that book right up. Called it “heretical”. 'Course, he was just feedin' us a line.
You should have seen his face light up when he first heard us mention it.
Common citizens may go no further without permission. Go home.
P-princess?! But what are you doing here?
Captain Schwann ... I could never refuse entry to either of you ...
You should know though, Sir Cumore's residence is currently uninhabited.
Captain Cumore struggled numerous times to exhibit proper ... conduct as a Knight.
During his assignments at Heliord and Mantaic, he was at the center of some rather unseemly developments.
As a result, he was stripped not only of his home, but of his noble status as well.
What's more, his sister, Miss Mimula, was recently apprehended for her involvement in aiding the extremists.
It hasn't been long since she was taken into custody, so she should still be down in the prison.
Darn it. I'm in a real pickle now ...
You got a look at them, though, didn't you? The one that stole the boat ...
Oh I saw 'im all right. He was carryin' this big ol' black bag, and he was dressed like a butler.
Well, why didn't you get another boat, and take off after him, then?
Oh phooey, you're just hopeless ...
Oh come on, it's not like we're leaving empty-handed.
Still, I'm always a little bit bummed when we don't find any blastia.
Yes, but this may just be the clue we need to untangle the mystery of blastia once and for all.
Shut yer hole and leave me be.
Everlight ... whoo boy. Whoo nanny, whoo nanny ...
Are ya sure that's what ya wanna know? Why don't I tell ya the measurements of that fine young thing who works in the item shop, instead?
Now now, let's not stand on formalities and such.
What brings you here?
I'm sorry, but there is no longer an inn or any shops in this town.
Yes. It's just me.
The humans of this town once called me that.
How perceptive. Blastia cannot easily be acquired, nor do we have the clear ciel crystal ...
The Children of the Full Moon should never have signed the pact with the Entelexeia.
They agreed to bury most of the blastia, with the Children standing watch over the rest.
Well, I thought you were perceptive, but now I see you actually know nothing.
Please, there's no need to speak in hushed tones.
The pact will surely be forsaken. Unless, that is, all blastia can be done away with for good.
A certain type of life can be led, even without blastia.
So it has always been. They come to depend on anything that eases the burdens of life.
I, too, was poisoned by the desire for greater things. I couldn't ignore the convenience.
To be a sage means only to be rich in knowledge. I too belong to the society of people.
Well put. And the Children of the Full Moon are no different.
The role of supervisor will turn into one of absolute authority before long.
Anyway, nothing remains in this village. Not even blastia.
You are welcome to stay the night, if you don't mind the ramblings of an old man.
Is there something else you require?
As my fellow Krityans left for their new home in the sky, I too needed a place of refuge.
I got left behind in the commotion. Didn't that happen to you, too, young lady?
On the contrary, a pleasing calm settled over this place after everyone had moved on.
If ya head for the sea from here, ya can't help running into Ehmead Hill.
They say there's the remains of some monster in the ground about halfway up.
The story goes that this monster was as long as the trunk of the Tree of Halure. Big, right?
Not long ago, I caught sight of a gallant man on my way home from the port city.
He was tall and slender, with silver hair. He headed into the mountains, and nobody's seen him since.
He was far too handsome to be a hermit ... I wonder who he could have been ...
Hm hm hmmm ...
Oh, you've returned! Look what I found when I was cleaning my dresser.
I was hoping you would ask. If memory serves, it is one of the nine fell arms of legend.
Hmph, I don't know how the story is told below, but here the legend is as follows:
At the height of the ancient blastia civilization, an attempt was made to produce special weapons.
Eventually, this led to the creation of armaments of untold power, nine in total.
I can't remember for the life of me. It's been decades since I've cleaned this thing out.
Huh? Oh, fine by me.
To tell the truth, I'm glad it turned up, but I'd been wondering what I'd do with it.
I've got no real use for it. Besides, it would be a shame to just leave something like this lying around.
I figure you are just the ones to put it to proper use.
Let me see here ...
According to the legend, the nine weapons share a common bond.
If this is truly one of the fell arms, it may react if brought near the others.
Hmm ... Then perhaps it isn't a fell arm after all.
Ho ho.
If the legends speak true.
Ho ho.
Hey, look at this funny-looking thingamabob I found.
Archie, you've found a part of a blastia housing.
This is so awesome, Mark. I'll bet it's a priceless historical artifact.
Let's get this back to Aspio quickly and show it to the researchers.
Don't forget to write your name on it to prove you're the one who found it.
Wh-what's going on?!
It’s my natural right as the one who found it.
Look, Archie, I think the little mage is going to give us a presentation.
Hmph ... Why's she so high and mighty ... ?
Yes, ma'am.
I've never heard so many words come out of such a little person ...
... I think we'd be better off doing as she says.
Hello there. Mind if I ask who your connection is?
I'm afraid not. I'm not quite like the other merchants, you see.
Yes, yes, most correct. I am Mercedes Dunkel, black marketeer extraordinaire.
A salesman for Leviathan's Claw. I travel the wide world, selling my weapons wherever I set up shop.
Ah hah hah. Henchman has such a villainous ring to it.
Hah hah, I suppose I could show such an honest young lady my wares. I can't sell you anything, though.
Here. This is a hoplon blastia that can spray a target with flames up to 100 meters away.

Yeah, must belong to whoever dug it out of the ground.
... Oh, well now. You're Brave Vesperia, aren't you?
A man in black, a princess-like young lady, a mage, a man from the Union, a young boy, a femme fatale, and a dog.
I received word from Yeager to treat you with extreme caution should we meet.
And with that I'll be bringing our little business engagement to a close.
H-hold on, now, do you enjoy threatening poor, defenseless merchants?

Just like the man says. So if it's all right with you, I'm going to get back to earning a living, here.
Come see us again real soon, 'kay?
What's wrong, Gauche? Droite?
Pardon me, but ... are you acquaintances of the two young ladies?
Oh, I'm so relieved.
I worry about those girls. They have the misfortune of being easily misunderstood, you see ...
But now that I see they have this many friends, I can stop my worrying.
I am the governess of this home, and they once lived under its roof.
This orphanage was built to shelter those children who have no one to depend on.
The two of them lost their family in the war ten years ago.
Hey, who are they?
If they're our big sis' enemies, I'll beat 'em up!
Here now, hush, both of you.
Oh my, no. I could never manage all of this alone. It is all made possible by the donations I receive.
Yeager is his name. He really does too much for us ...
I don't know his reasons. But he has never asked for anything in return.
Nanny! I'm hungry!
Oh yes, it's time, isn't it? I'm sorry, I must be going.
... Humanity at work. Their tenacious attachment to this life ...
Why ... ? Why must humans live the lives they do?

Perhaps there is truth in what you say ...

But where is it flowing ... ?
Traces left behind by the flow of aer ...
But where is it flowing ... ?
... Monster?

“Monster” ...
It matters not what humans call them, but ...

Indeed, the Kritya have always been a peaceful race.
We laugh and we cry, but seldom do we fight.
Err, well ...
It seems it's not so much a depiction of real life, as it is a scene that the artist thought would be cool to paint.
Well, that was all a long time ago. But we do know that around that time, a certain type of magic was developed.
It was a powerful arte called Astion, and apparently it served them quite well in the battle.
I'm sorry, but I don't know the magic. I wouldn't be able to teach it to you.
Come now, don't be so critical. Perhaps this can make up for my ignorance.
This is my one and only Bush Baby doll.
Please, take good care of it.
It's possible the knowledge of Astion is still being passed on among our brethren who descended down onto the planet's surface.
Well, I don't think that all of them are as well-versed in the old Krityan lore as others. But someone might know of it.
Ah, so you've returned.
We gave up blastia as a race so that we might not repeat the mistakes of our ancestors.
And then this mural was left behind, so that the dire consequences of these mistakes might be known to later generations.
However, fearing that this knowledge would bring confusion to our brethren, our ancestors hid the mural within this wall.
Those who handed down the lore of the Kritya were the only ones entrusted with this truth ...
Yes ... but now that I think about it, perhaps it was a mistake to keep it a secret.
We should have told everyone of these events earlier, and worked together to find a way to fight against the Adephagos.
Thank you, thank you, Miss Earth-Dweller.
Hello! Is everyone else coming ... ?
Ah ... what's that painting doing here?
Oh ... well, you see, this was ... passed down from our ancestors ...
Hellooo, I hope I'm not late. Wait, what is that ... ?
This is that thing that's floating up in the sky out there. Look, everyone's fighting it!
The Krityans are holding spears, too!
Wooow, cool!
Indeed it is, little one.
How could you keep something as cool as this all for yourself, Mr. Elder? That's not fair!
Sorry, little one, but my grandfather told me to take good care of it.
It was too much trouble to leave it out, so I hid it.
The Krityans fought against the monster, too!
And then they wiped it out!
We need to be brave, too!
All right, let's have our meeting! We need to discuss what measures we can take against the monster!
Well then, if you'll excuse us ...
So, word has it that you've been going around doing something or another to the world's Entelexeia.
Oh ho, I see ... it is as I thought.
Indeed, I suspected that you would be working to defeat the Adephagos.
I am correct, am I not?
Perhaps it would interest you to know that our people have been considering going down to the surface.
The time may soon come for Krones, the Entelexeia who carries Myorzo through the air,
to turn into an elemental spirit and help your cause. Do you not think that likely?
The less patient among us have already gone down to the surface.
I do not know. Though I would imagine they'd be hard to miss.
Mmph.
Hey, it's you.
We heard that Myorzo's days of floating in the sky might soon be over, so we've been scoping out places to live on the surface.
I see ... what should we do, then?
Hmmm ... that sounds hard.
I don't suppose something like this would be of much use to anyone ...
There's no way anyone would be able to use an arcane spear arte like this ...
It's possible that our people came up with them back when we fought the Adephagos, a thousand years ago.
There are many artes that our own people do not use ... perhaps we only worked out the theory, but never put them into practice.
Wow, amazing. For a Krityan, you are very skilled.
I see. We cannot lend you our force in battle, so we shall lend you our wisdom.
We're happy to do whatever we can if it will help you in your quest.
Ahhh! You there, in black! Yes, you!
I've been looking for you!
You've got a bounty on you, right?
No, please wait! I'm not going to turn you in! Please, listen to what I have to say.
Yes, of course, I'm sorry. My name is Shel. And you would be ... Yuri?
Yuri! Is that you, Yuri?
You don't remember me? I sure as heck-fire remember you! It's Hachette!
Ouch! It's nice to see you too, Yuri ...
Yep! I'm in the Schwann Brigade!
To tell you the truth, I'm pretty glad they didn't assign me to the Flynn Brigade.
Well, it would be tough working under him, since we started off training to be soldiers together.
It's pretty crazy for a non-noble to make captain at such a young age.
Me on the other hand ... thanks to all the goofing off I did with you, Yuri, I'm still nothing but a lowly peon.
We used to skip training and sneak into the dining hall to grab snacks.
It's true. We had our fair share of youthful indiscretions.
Ha ha, I've heard as much. Go easy on Flynn, would ya?
Oh yeah, Yuri, you've been traveling around, right?
You think you might be able to stop by Capua Nor and tell my folks that I'm doing well?
They live in the inn, so you can't miss 'em.
Wow, what a strange group of people. A dog and even a couple of kids ... and they don't look like they're related, either.
As the gateway to all of Tolbyccia, Capua Torim sees its fair share of interesting folks.
A motley crew like theirs isn't too uncommon among all of the guilds that pass through here.
But I could swear that I've seen that young man somewhere before ...
You too, ma'am? To tell the truth, he looks familiar to me, too.
I wonder where I've seen his face ...
Your room is the last one down, on the right. Have a pleasant stay.
Is the wanted man really hiding in here?
I'm sure.
I thought I'd seen him somewhere before. And then I spotted the wanted poster, I immediately knew it was him.
That room up ahead, hmm ... All right. You stand back.
Yes, of course.
The wanted man has three friends with him. They've also got a dog, so be careful.
An Imperial Knight won't be beaten by the likes of a common criminal!
All right, put your hands up and come quietly ... huh?
They got away!!
They say two more people went missing last night.
You'd think people would know better, with that guild's reputation for loan-sharking. But I guess the tourists don't have any idea what they're getting into.
Isn't the guild in cahoots with the tipsters? Nordopolica regulars wouldn't fall for a scam like that ...
Where do they take the people who go missing?
Who can say? But no one ever comes back, that's for sure.
I hope no one disappears tonight ...
Eeek! H-help me ... Someone, someone please help!
Not only do you team up with the tipsters to rip off innocent customers,
but then you kidnap people who couldn't pay their debts and do away with them! You dirty piece of slime ... This is what you deserve!
Aaaaaaah!
Is the ocean bigger than the lake?
It's much bigger, and much deeper. The ocean is bluer than any lake, and prettier, too!
Fish live in the ocean, right? Where is it?
Is it far from here?
Yeah, it's a little far from here.
Aw man! I wanted to go see it!
You can go when you get older. You can get on a big ship and go to other cities, and see all sorts of new stuff!
Yeah!
... Aahh!
I caught you red-handed, you scum! Stop! Stop in the name of the Imperial Knights!
Hey, thanks for the help back there.
And you reproduced the move I used back in Nordopolica perfectly ...
Ah, so you noticed. We're two of a kind, you know. Maybe fate's brought us together.
I know who you are. Yuri Lowell, you're a man who's had to get his hands dirty, just like me.
Unfortunately, I don't think I really have time for us to get all chummy.
But just for tonight, I'll let you ask me one question. Besides my name, that is.
Let's just say my reasons are not the same as yours.
I'm looking for the man who killed my swordsmanship teacher. I'm just purging the world of a few villains in the meantime.
Just a little collateral damage. But it's who I am.
It's fine if you don't understand. Maybe it's better, even.
You can still turn back.
I thought I told you, you only get one question.
Well, I'm off. I hope that our paths don't cross again.
Acting Commandant Flynn! Perfect timing!
We'd like you to look over the draft for reorganizing the Schwann Brigade and the old Royal Guard.
Looks like fate has brought us together again, Yuri Lowell.
Welcome back, Acting Commandant Flynn, sir!
Yes sir! Please follow me.
Princess ... what are you doing in a place like this?
I heard about you slipping out of the castle.
I apologize for not having introduced myself sooner. My name is Drake Dropwart.
Back when we had that stand-off with Palestralle, he got crushed in the stampede of onlookers, and he ended up like that.
... Leave me alone!
You're going to heal me, and then I'll owe you tons of money, huh? That's quite a scam! Hmph!
You think I'm gonna die from a puny little wound like this?!
Y-you can't be serious ... !
Some pretty flowers to give to your parents? Or your sister? Or someone you love ... ? Oh, you over there ...
Ah, it's you ...
N-no ... That's not quite right ...
W-well, you see ...
Unfortunately, that's the case ... we've actually been renting the orphanage building from a certain well-known man in town.
But since we've stopped receiving contributions from Yeager, we're no longer able to pay that debt.
The rent for the building aside, it takes a lot of money to feed the children ...
They're all still struggling to make a living for themselves. It would be far too much to ask them for help with something like this.
Gauche and Droite are in the same situation.
They were both working for Yeager.
But now that he's passed away, they're probably having just as hard a time as anybody.
... Oh, sir, would you like to buy some flowers ... ?
Let's see ... 500,000 Gald should be enough ...
But I can't just let you give me so much of your own money ...
What are you talking about ... ?
Ummm ... well, I don't really understand, but ...
No, that's okay ...
What? I ... I ... Really ... ?
Phew ... what should I do ... ? If I only had ... 500,000 Gald ...
But I can't just let you give me so much of your own money ...
What are you talking about ... ?
Ummm ... well, I don't really understand, but ...
No, that's okay ...
Red ... so very red ... This year's especially bad ...
Oh ho. You're back?
Oh, it's just that this year's flowers are an especially deep shade of red, so I was thinking that the curse of the caged emperor's bride must be particularly strong this year ...
But ... I'm just joking, of course.
Legend has it that the caged emperor murdered his fiancée, and buried her corpse beneath the roots of this tree.
The tree gets its red color from the murdered bride's blood, which its roots absorb.
It's really nothing more than a legend.
Yes. But I'm worried that this macabre tale will spread and drive potential visitors away from our town.
I ... uhh ... Oops. Okay, forget all about that story I just told you, could you?
If you don't forget it, the caged emperor's bride will hold a grudge against you ...
Oops ...
Th-they say that some lady's body is buried under this tree ...
Y-yeah, I hear that she was the wife of some emperor a long time ago ...
Nuh-uh! I heard that she died before the wedding! So she wasn't his wife.
Whatever! It's s-scary, but ... I think it's true!
Yeah, Halure's flowers are so cool ... it's hard to believe something weird like that happened ...
Th-this explains what's been making us feel so funny about this tree ...
Nuh-uh ... The Mayor told it to us!
And what about this ... ?
A white shadow, like a ghost, dropped it!
It's true!
The Mayor went around and asked everybody, but it didn't belong to anybody ...
This girl is really scary ...
Let's get out of here ...
Hey! It's the healer girl!
Wow ... So that's why the flowers are red!
So that's the real story!
Miss, thank you for the wonderful story!
You should tell that story to the Mayor, too!
Thank you for the lovely story ...
... I have dwelled at the base of this tree for many generations ...
If you wish to give me a name, you could refer to me as the flower maiden of your story.
Those children saw me, and I'm afraid that started an unfortunate rumor.
Yes ... and I even dropped my veil ...
No ... I shall let you keep that.
Thanks to you, the unfortunate rumor was put to rest.
No ... I shall give you another token of my gratitude.
I have given you a new ability.
Perhaps it will help you protect your companions.
Farewell ...
Ah, my boy!
Thank you so very much! I just took my eyes off him for a second and he disappeared!
Nora, come down from there!
Our dear Nora is stuck up there, and she won't come down!
Oh, Nora moved ...
Thank you so much!
I see ... so the Chief and the others left town this morning.
I'm not sure if they left the town, but they did spend the night here last night,
and I'm fairly sure that their leader was your Chief.
I see.
Oh, he said something about being a member of a guild called the Hunting Blades, I believe.
It seems he got separated from the rest of his guild, though.
Nan?
Yeah, they were here until early this morning.
Actually, I seem to remember someone like that, yes ... She looked like she'd be injured, somehow.
